review:
Really cool game! Recommended for local multiplayer or try "online" via Steam Remote Play Together. 
(I read in another review that the built-in online feature was broken, I haven't tried it nor the Steam Remote Play Togehter with this game.)

The stealth mechanics are spot on and the kills feel good.
The platforming and sword striking needs to be explained more but once you get it down it all makes sense and feels great. If you're skilled you can go from one end of the screen to the other by double jumping and dashstriking.

Players:
* Single player vs bots in Death match, Flag Capture and Challenge mode.
* 2 -4 players in local multiplayer

[h1]Game modes:[/h1]
[b]Death match:[/b]
First to a number of kills.

[b]Flag Capture:[/b]
One flag randomly spawns and your team needs to capture it by standing next to it and holding the flag capture button.
The mode is played as a tug-of-war. When one team captures the flag more of the screen turns into their color, until all of the screen is lit up in one team's color after which the leading team needs to score one more capture.

[b]Challenge:[/b]
A special single player game of Flag Capture with a bunch of bots spawning in in the opposite color. The game is played until the player loses a life.

[h1]Movement:[/h1]
You can sneak by holding a button, when doing this you can be completely invisible if the background is the same as your color. You give away your position if you run, jump, strike or land.
You can double-jump and additionally dash-strike in any direction while airborne. By doing this you can reach great heights  or jump far across the screen. Note that you can only strike once when airborne. You get the next strike when you land on ground or a wall
You can only strike once with your sword when airborne. Touch a wall or ground to get another strike.

[h1]Items[/h1]
You keep items after death. There is no way to discard items you need to use them before you can pick up another item.

[b]Smoke bombs[/b]
These work as teleporters. Drop a smoke bomb in one place and then drop another smoke bomb to teleport to that location. You can get som sneaky kills with this one.

[b]Shuriken[/b]
Ranged weapon, throw to kill.

[b]Shards[/b]
Drop them on the ground. If an enemy steps on them their feet will bleed and leave a trail even when the players is invisible. This only affects the other team.

[h1]Bugs and Suggestions:[/h1]
[b]Bug/Oversight: Unable to play 2 players + 1 bot on each team[/b]
When you try to play 1 white player + 1 black player and add 2 bots the bots both show up on the same team. Playing 2 players vs 2 bots works though.

[b]Suggestion: Using picked up item as bait[/b]
I know this game was released several years ago but if you would make one small adjustment I would like it to be this one.
The game has a button for revealing the item you are holding. If you are invisible and holding the button it almost looks like a regular pickup, but it\s shinier, not animated and the wrong height. It would be awesome if you could trick an enemy to go to your location and then kill them when they arive.

review:
Black & White Bushido is a neat little 'hide & seek' title that is fun to play with friends. Although I do think that there are similarly-styled games out there that do the genre a little better, I had a blast playing with my buddy and certainly imagine the game would have been even more fun with a full crew of 4-players stalking about! 

A (minor) complaint I have with this game is that it's easy to lose track of where your own character is. I think this could be easily remedied with a little 'player icon' that's only viewable on your screen but it's unlikely to ever get implemented as this is a mildly older title. Granted, this particular complaint exists on several of the games in this genre so it's not really anything that would take away from the overall fun. 

A cool little game but definitely avoid paying the full price as there isn't really much content outside of the multiplayer experience. I'd say that this game is a great value when purchased for $1 - $3 USD. You'll likely have a solid amount of fun with it for a few hours but then not pick it up again for a while (if ever) so it's not worth spending a lot but the fun to be had *is* worth a little something-something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058159844', 'num_games_owned': 1055, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1577576490}
review:
It’s time to talk about one of my favourite types of game; competitive local multiplayer. I like this type of game because I don’t feel like it needs to be rigorously tested for visual and mechanical perfection. [i]Black & White Bushido[/i] is in no way perfect, with plenty of dodgy animation and complex, poorly-explained weapons, but ultimately it’s a local multiplayer game that’s easy to set up (much easier than setting up [i]Mario Kart Wii[/i] with Xbox controllers on Dolphin while everyone’s vocally expressing frustration that I somehow haven’t set it up yet), has an interesting hook that’s well-executed, and fulfils the be-all and end-all of game-assessing criteria: it’s [i]fun[/i].

Best played locally and preferably with four players but still very fresh and exciting with fewer, [i]Black & White Bushido[/i] takes place in a totally black-and-white [i]Smash Bros.[/i]-style level in which the patches of black and white constantly shift. As either a black or white character, the game encourages you to hide in the patches of your chosen shade, waiting for the perfect moment to finish off other players with a single, well-timed strike. You’re only totally invisible when standing still to camouflage or holding a button to slowly move around, and appropriately dramatic splashes of dust indicate where you’re landing or leaping, so it’s not as broken as it may initially seem.

In fact, it’s just really well-designed in general. It’s very much about trying to time that perfect attack to get through an enemy’s defences, and since striking enemies as they strike you just bounces you both backwards, rushing headlong into battle is a good way to get killed quickly. There’s not much really bad about [i]Black & White Bushido[/i], and unless you’re somehow still expecting games like this to have a large, competitive online multiplayer scene, this won’t disappoint. An excellent addition to the party game pantheon, but not one to go into without a few friends.

review:
un jeu de ... capture the flag/deathmatch/etc... en 2D plateforme, sur le thème du japon medieval.
controles pas intuitifs et pas réactifs, hitbox foirée.
graphismes... difficile à dire, ce ne sont que des silhouettes.
et que du blanc et noir. de quoi bien te niquer les yeux en moins de 2 minutes.Les personnages n'étant pas bien grand, si vous vous amusez à régler des contrastes trop léger, vous aller en suer grave à voir ce qui ce passe. idée à la con vraiment...
Il y a des gens, comme ça, qui s'imagine faire dans l'originalité artistique mais qui, au final, nique COMPLETEMENT l'ergonomie et le confort visuel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980061282', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1514934408}
review:
Honestly we need some more samurai/ninja party games like this, because they ARE fun but they ALL have problems... 

The concept of this one is 4 player semi-stealth clash battle with asian influence characters and theme. It's great I love the design and idea of this game. (They must've really wanted to stay away from ninja models to be uniqe?) 

It does have an online which is a plus for sure, but the offline kind of suffers from lack of variety or real challenge in terms of difficulty. The bots are terrible so have friends or use discord groups. 

The gameplay is pretty straight forward; it's 2D platforming with stealth mechanics to wide in your team's color, White or Black. There's a deathmatch, capture the flag, objectives (finish 3 specific challenges first). That's about it. You have a choice of multiple varied maps all ink based which adds to the style and theme of the game. Every character plays the same, just varied models, it's a 1-hit kill system if they touch you with their attack you're dead. Of course there's respawn. Also it has a smashbros-esqe item drop but of only a couple items to confuse or slow your foe. Unfortunately nothing really FEELS great.
 
In terms of actual gameplay, I prefer Samurai Gun's mechanics, there's simply more to the combat especially when you clash and add a dedicated range weapon for everyone. Also I feel SG is just a faster game even locked at 30FPS. While BWB has intentional slow animations to make it easier to read I guess but it just looks and feels clunky. The animations and lack of extra in-game fighting mechanics makes it hard to reccomend. Maybe for those that don't play these kinds of games and having too much go on could make it confusing, but even with SG at parties everyone was pretty much on board with little complaints. 

The thing is SG isn't supported anymore... Hasn't had a sale here for some time and dev has pretty much ignored it. No Online play, prolly will never come so I'd say support this title just because it has support.

So with that in mind I say pick this up here or on the Nintendo Switch when that comes out and hey they might fix those problems cause they still work on their games.

The idea of this game is great, but unfortunately poorly executed. "Stealth", the essence of the game will be meaningless if you have to be exposed to your enemy as soon as you get moving. Instead of being half-transparent to both parties, while holding the button to "blend into the environement", you should be completely invisible to your opponents and only visible by yourself even if you are walking, jumping or gliding. That's the reasonable expectation. I know this is impossible for local multiplayer mode but it's actually what it should look like, at least for online multiplayer.

review:
This game has great potential, but needs a player base. 
4 of us bought the game together and after a few rounds we got bored of fighting each other. No other players online =(
However, This is a great game! The level and character designs are stylistically sound despite using only a handful of colours. Movement and Sound are well polished too, making this game really fluid. The fighting is about timing and the stealth mechanic works really well. 

Replayabilty is my biggest issue from this game. 
Definitely could use a single player campaign - perhaps a side scroller like ninja gaiden mixed with the stealth mechanic.
Co-op campaign would be even better!
Multiplayer could use a bigger arena with more players and a way to block incoming attacks (not attack parry).
I'd suggest making cross platform (xbox > pc, ps4 > pc) servers otherwise this game will die shortly on pc. An auto matchmake would also help players find others to play against.
The more promo, the more players. I only got this game because of the EGX 2017 stand and promo sale (75%).  

I hope that this game gets the recognition it deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070051610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1517796540}
review:
Short version: 

Worth buying at 75% off, if you have friends to play it with.  Not worth full price. Don't expect to find people to play with online.

Long:

Black & White Bushido is a game heavily based on stealth.  You can play either Light (white ninjas) or Shadow (black ninja).  There are four character models, though (ironically for a game so heavily based on the popular idea of ninjas), none of them are in stereotypical ninja garb.  You then choose to play online or offline.  

Offline, you can play either against bots or (presumably, since I've never tried it) couch two player.  The stage is small, so there's no need for split screen.  Online, you can try to find a match, but the matchmaking is extremely barebones. I play with my fiancee, and the only way we can find each other's matches is by coordinating over the phone.  There is no indication of who else is playing, even once you're in the match.  You don't see screen names, just "Player 1."  Also, as many other reviews have noted, there is virtually no community for this game.  If you want to play against a human, bring a friend.

You will want to play against humans, too, because the bots are particularly idiotic.  Gameplay is heavily dependent on stealth.  If you break stealth, every bot will simultaneously converge on you.  I'm not a particularly good gamer, but my kill-death ratio against the bots is usually 20-1, even outnumbered 3 to 1.   If you go into stealth, the bots just beginning patrolling their platform with no attempt to locate you or use stealth themselves.  This makes them easy pickings even for a new player.  Really, the bots are just good for learning the controls.

So what about the gameplay? That's where this game shines.  Primarily, you'll attack using your melee weapon, a very simple one-button attack.  The twist comes with the stealth mechanic.  The levels continually shift between light and shadow (white or black backgrounds, in other words).  The ninjas can, when standing still, blend into the background, making them impossible to see.  They can also move in this stealth mode, though at a greatly reduced speed.  Jumping will give away their position, as will fast movement.

The stealth is the key part.  Trying to sneak up on an opponent while your character is invisible to both you and your opponent is a lot of fun.  The game throws in a few twists for you, too.  Tired of waiting? There's a taunt mechanic to reveal your position and lure adversary out of cover. Smoke bombs, a special item, allow you to mark a location, and then basically teleport back to it later.  Drop a smoke bomb, move somewhere else, and attack from hiding.  Go back into stealth after the attack and teleport back to your old spot.  Your opponent now has no idea where you are.  On the defensive side, there are caltrops, effectively three-pointed tacks that cause your opponent to bleed when he walks over them, giving away his position. You also can pick up shurikens or spears to give yourself a ranged attack against a melee-based opponent.

Because of all this, there's a lot of flexibility against a skilled human.  Do you want to silently stalk your opponent and strike from hiding?  Do you want to depend on fast movement and aggressive attacks to get you through? Both of those are options.

There are at least three game modes that I've tried: deathmatch, capture the flag, and challenge mode, where you try to score kills based on challenges. If I run across others, I'll add them here.  Up to four players can play in a match, and each player can choose if they'll be light or shadow.

The art style is stark, but appealling.  It's heavily influenced by traditional Japanese art, contributing to the feel of the overall game.  It's simple, but it's a key part of this game, and it works.

The overall result is good, but feels like a high quality flash game.  There is literally no story, no campaign, and no way to "beat the game."  There are no ranks.  It's just pick up and play.  If you have friends who will play this with you, then the 75% off price is worth it.  I've played it for an hour so far with my fiancee, and it's worth $3.24.  It is not worth $12.99, however.  There's just not enough here to justify that price.

So, to reiterate: Buy on sale, play with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096538763', 'num_games_owned': 2826, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1517462889}
review:
【ACT】【精品小游戏】
《黑白武士道》
[h1]画面：[/h1]
简洁的黑白画风，加上水墨风格，极具视觉冲击力，每个场景都能带你体味东瀛特色。

[h1]音乐：[/h1]
节奏轻缓的日式古典音乐，一来能让人快速融入游戏氛围，二来在紧张激烈的战斗不仅不显得突兀，反而衬托出不同角色激烈战斗中的凄凉之感。

[h1]战斗：[/h1]
整个游戏的核心就是战斗，玩家共有四名角色可以选择，分别为武士、大名？、艺伎？、僧侣。每个角色武器不同，但实际操作中并没有太大的差异。
战斗则十分简单，二段跳、冲刺、攻击，但就是简单的操作，才更容易出现极致的快感。本就快节奏的移动出刀，再加上拼刀的判定，使得战斗充满变化和激情。
而如此模式的战斗，之前购买的玩家就很惋惜为什么没有在线多人，那么现在在线多人已经推出了，快约上几个小伙伴一起爽快厮杀吧！


锦上添花的是，游戏已增添中文，虽然原本就不需要太多理解，但毕竟增加中文更加易懂。

[h1]缺点：[/h1]
多人对战从来就没连上过，可能是人太少了。
游戏本身的机制和难度也存在硬伤，夺旗的意义不明确，也没有数量限制，超过之后还会为对方增加色彩。
对战的时候也可以增加击杀死亡比，各类击杀数等数据，有数据之后的撕逼就更加有说服力。

大概折扣的时候入手四人包还是比较值的，推荐杉果购买。

review:
Un juego de enganche rapido y fácil control! Black and white nos presenta al ejercito de la LUZ y de la OSCURIDAD enfrentados una vez más!, pero lo hace de una manera muy singular...cada uno en su medio (blanco o negro)...tiene la ventaja!, quedarse quieto mientras tu contrincante no sabe que estas en las sombras, o en las...luces? y asestarle un "katanazo" no tiene desperdicio!

Ahora incluye un modo multijugador, pero, las dos veces que lo intente creo que no hay muchos servidores.

Mi visión del juego es siempre una tarde con parejas, amig@s, familia, incluso enemigos ( como siempre digo para golpeales con tu superioridad vicieta y videojueguil ) lo que veais oportuno, acción, diversión y tensión para hasta 4 jugadores, lo pasareis genial!. author: {'steamid': '76561198247242474', 'num_games_owned': 2553, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1483456739}
review:
一款黑白水墨画风的碎片化小型消磨时间爽型游戏
音乐很东瀛，角色很东瀛；
非黑即白，非动即静，非死即活，非敌即我！
这是一款非常非常非常纯粹的游戏！
这是一款值得推荐的游戏。
支持本地分屏，但是不支持线上联机是一个遗憾。
没有中文，但是不影响游戏





画

黑白水墨风，非常有意境；另外游戏内的场景有五个，各有特点，不得不佩服，东瀛那嘎达把我们的水墨韵味搞得很有厚度，相反为什么我们的游戏作者总喜欢去模仿日式或者欧美风的主题风格呢？


音


一听就知道是标准的东瀛风格音乐，契合游戏主题画面，不得不说很搭，音乐风格和美术风格真的很搭……音效很不错，尤其是斩击时候的音效配合斩击后的的那种心情，畅快淋漓！但是我觉得如果五张地图，能有五个风格独特区别比较大的BGM就更好了。


玩


游戏支持单人游戏与本地分屏游戏，不支持联机；
游戏有两种模式：对战模式（玩家VS玩家  or 玩家VS AI）、挑战模式，但是实际上队长模式有一部分和挑战模式重复（达成目标条件才可以达成通关[比如斩杀一人，站立8秒不动、使用道具多少次、空中斩杀几人等]）角色：有四个角色可以选——武士、打伞女人、僧人、大锤（又分别可以选黑或者白）招式：只有跳跃、二段跳、原地攻击、方向攻击（快速斩杀/拔刀斩）、道具使用、占领旗帜；招式很简单，但是对战起来基本就是冲杀！冲杀！冲杀与冲杀！（怂什么，正面肛！）黑与白：当角色当前颜色与背景颜色相同时，静止不动则进入隐身效果，敌人不会发现，如果动则会被敌人察觉；当角色当前颜色与背景颜色相悖时，则暴露在敌人的视觉之下，很容易被斩杀。对砍：原地砍没有意思，用快速斩杀/拔刀斩杀人才是王道，尤其是如果敌人也用拔刀斩和你对着干，大家都会被弹开，接着进行第二次冲刺。武士之道，不是死，就是死！道具：三种——铁蒺藜、手里剑和烟雾弹；铁蒺藜洒落到地面，敌人碰到会持续掉血，手里剑远程杀敌、烟雾弹可以掩饰与瞬移；游戏将就一击致命，其他都是多余。


一点小遗憾


AI比较蠢
不支持联机，如果在线联机，这款游戏一定会火，因为两个实实在在的玩家会充分利用黑白之道与道具、在潜行与暗杀之间体验一击毙命的刺激感觉；然而不支持联机，只能杀一杀愚蠢的AI；
对战模式的条件限制比较烦，我个人期望的是对战模式类似闯关，第一关杀一个，第二关杀两个，第三关杀三个以此类推的闯关模式，这样一个可以玩的很爽，怎么杀人，杀几个全看自己，另外不断地挑战也可以看到自己的极限；在对战模式的情况下加入通关条件限制是一件很烦的事情，毕竟已经有挑战模式了不是么……
游戏真的还不错，碎片化，爽快，不拖沓，画面和音乐都挺好，唯独不能联机……
如果能开联机，我会给基友们买几个……反正也不贵。

author: {'steamid': '76561198169115755', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1537957592}
review:
Un jeu au concept simple mais extrêmement efficace, à condition d'avoir des amis avec vous pour en profiter. Il s'agit de se défier en duel dans un monde bichrome. 

-Vous êtes noir ou blanc. 

-Le décor et noir et blanc. 

-Caché dans votre couleur, vous êtes invisible. Hors d'elle, on ne voit plus que vous. 

-Le tout est de se montrer et se cacher quand il faut, souvent pour finir par surgir brutalement sur votre adversaire dès qu'il a commis un faux pas ou que vous avez deviné ses plans, ses mouvements. 

-Pour prévenir les excès de timidité, le décor change de couleur régulièrement, découvrant ainsi certaines zones aléatoirement. Vous l'aurez compris : les joueurs cachés dans ces zones se retrouvent alors d'un coup très vulnérables !

Conclusion : oubliez un peu la couleur, passez au noir et blanc ! Le jeu vaut son prix !

review:
B&W Bushido is a nice indie-multiplayer PvP platformer up to 4 players.

- The setting takes us to Feudal Japan.
- The main feature of this game is Confrontation between Blackness Black and Glaring White. Players capture points on the level, colouring the area in black or white. This helps the team which captured the point, since it makes its' player barely visible unless they Run or Jump, raising a cloud of dust behind them. 
- Simplistic combat mechanic and Minimalistic Graphic style.

Devs pledged to add online multiplayer, because there is none at the moment and you can only play together on one computer. Which is sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103319892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1468187714}
review:
I'm gonna start this review by saying that this is a first impressions review (as of right now i have played half an hour of this game), and that I know nothing of the game (when it was released, the developers, the budget, the time it took to make, etc.), so opinions may change with further playing

Pros:
+Good atmosphere
+Music and sound effects aren't the best but do the job
+Hammer character is kinda fun

Pros/Cons together:
+/-Idea of light and shadow is very good, and the stealth part would be interesting as a mechanic if the player sitting still on his or her's area didn't already make him invisible, rendering it useless
+/-Art style has potential, but is horrendously bad (as in 2000s flash games you'd find on free games websites bad) with no options for better detail

Cons:
-Animations feel cheap and uninteresting,  with many attack having very few frames for said animations
-Platforming feels very off, almost Zelda CD-i off, very unresponsive and hard
-Spear guy is horrible to play with
-The absolute worst are the controls, both in game and in the menus, with very little intuitive button choices for the keyboard (I understand this game is probably made for controller use, but almost never mentioning the controls on the keyboard, along with and offering the option to change anything? Shame), adding to this feeling of either going too fast with the dash (when you manage to do a dash) or too slow, you always feel like a slug. Sometimes they don't even register the keys I press!

All around, not even worth the 2-3 euros i payed with the sale

author: {'steamid': '76561198093259315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1495110975}
review:
呵~~~呵~~~嘿~~~
黑白武士道的想法嘿~只会用武士刀比划嘿~
我一个人在家乖乖的虐AIはぃはぃはぃゎかりました
日文(一二三四)樱花落满地有一种神秘凝结了空气
日文(一二三四)黑夜里偷袭去攻击烟雾当武器
日文(一二三四)忍者的物语要切断过去[strike]保命[/strike]是唯一
日文(一二三四)隐身要彻底要忘记什么是自己

+简约场景，简单操作，让人想起《绝望剑士nidhogg》，对比正面肛的西洋击剑，我觉得《黑与白的武士道》想要体现的是东洋忍术的隐忍暗杀，如果是联机PVP，大部分时间玩家可能只是在同色背景的保护下缓慢移动，悄悄地靠近对手，然后突然出现一击毙命。
-可惜的是，在单机对抗AI里，背景光源随机的快速切换，逼着玩家没空研究行进路线，只能跳来跳去，靠近对手之后一个冲刺赌运气。更糟糕的是，如果不按标志显示键，乱斗之后陷入同色的你甚至会找不到自己在哪……
+在此不得不佩服本子的拿来主义+美工+音乐，把游戏做的像黑泽明电影中某个场景一样梦幻。[spoiler]反观我大天朝╮(╯▽╰)╭[/spoiler]
-如果出在线联基，把光源改成惯性移动（随时间改变的月光）+突发（比如场地破坏，打倒灯笼等等），玩家跑动声响视觉化，再来个照明弹道具（烟雾弹已有，但是用处不大），那策略性和娱乐性会大大提高吧

当前版本评分：6/10

It is worth to buy cheap gamepad for this game and call few friends for a fight,

author: {'steamid': '76561198115455999', 'num_games_owned': 2091, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1660002268}
review:
This is a game about speed, stealth, and lighting.  The lighting seems to change at random times.

You play on either the light team or the dark team.  If you stand still while in your element (a light team member in the light, a dark team member in the shadow) you disappear from sight, and can hold a button to stay hidden and move slowly.  But if you dash (your typical movement speed), your outline becomes a bit easier to see.  I've found it's easier to distinguish a moving dark team member in shadow than it was to detect a moving light team member in light, which unbalances it a bit, but it's not too bad, and I'm sure its something the devs can easily fix.

When you're attacking, it's pretty much one hit kills, though there are glancing blows.  Also, when not stealthed, you're moving fast.  This really leads to two types of tactics.  Slow, methodical, waiting ninja strikes where you remember where you are while stealthed and wait for an opponent to either pass over you, or get close enough to dash and slice them up.  It's that, or you dash around, just trying to be faster than everyone else.  I've found either tactic works well, and obviously you can change up while you play, depending on the situation.

So with the dynamics at play, it makes the game feel like you're either a ninja, hiding in wait, or a samurai trying to out iajutsu everyone else.  Tons of fun, tons of flavor for a simple 4 person multiplayer game (no story, no single player except with bots).

Just the fact that this is a PC game with local multiplayer makes me like this game, everything else about it makes me love it.

Get this game, get three friends, and play this game!  NOW!

review:

    但是对于黑白场景的设定，东瀛风的渲染与不错的创意是不可否认的！如果能进行改进绝对不弱于其他优秀的撕逼游戏！希望作者再接再厉！还有！多人模式！求线上多人模式，我和我美国的朋友都没法联机了T T。

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2434, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1454797840}
review:
[b][i]Black & White Bushido[/i] is a fun little four player versus game that has a great novelty of really making you feel like a ninja through use of camoflauge.[/b] My regular [i]TowerFall[/i] group gave it the thumb's-up (which they rarely like anything but the usual). Its certainly smaller in scale, but has enough fun for a couple of gatherings. Overall, I do wish there was more content, though.

[i]The coolest thing about this game is its novelty; you first choose either a black or white ninja, which allows you to blend in really well with like color.[/i] This adds in some nice strategy where you can just sit still and wait for the kill. Its reminiscent of getting the mirror item in [i]TowerFall[/i]. Really makes you feel like a ninja.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Awesome use of the black and white camoflauge to make you feel like a boss with those stealth kills
+The whole level is on the screen at one time (like [i]TowerFall[/i] and unlike [i]Duck Game[/i]) - the moving camera in other games can bother some gamers with it constant zooming-in-and-out

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Content is slim; only a handful of levels (like 5 or 6), and two game modes (deathmatch and capture the flag)
-Music and sound effects are nothing to write home about
-Needs more weapons and consumables

[b]Get it on sale, if you are into local play.[/b]

review:
The concept was a what initially got me into this game. Besides the fact that it was on the theme of the perpetual fight between light and dark, this game plays very well. The controls are intuitively designed both on the controller and the keyboard and honestly, while this game is mostly for local matches, I'm having a blast so far playing against AIs and trying out challenges.

The game is already finished as it is but I could see more things being added, more warrior classes and maps, in addition to online multiplayer (which will be released in the summer of 2016).

The map is seamlessly designed, with the maps being rendered in brushstrokes.

It's on sale for $2. My advice is to try it out for yourself before a possible price increase when online multiplayer is introduced. 

Just imagine the chaos and intensity between the most renowned forces (light and dark) in the battle for supremacy. This one takes a sharp contrast to other games in its side-scrolling multiplayer genre.

review: I love Seven Samurai, Saumurai Jack, Ran, Zatoichi and Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon. For me games have rarely matched the fun and flow of the sword play and action on show in these films. So I was a bit sceptical when I first saw Black and White Bushido, but noticing the price drop I thought I'd have a go. And I'm glad I did, it's ridiculously good fun. You'll experience no greater joy than hiding in the shadows or light before swiping your opponent down. A great game and a mega bargain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026338871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1538708706}
review:
黑白武士道，日本武士道风格格斗游戏。
【画面】：水墨风格，简单线条勾勒,主要以黑白为主，黑白两色引起强烈的视觉反差

【音乐】：东洋风格，倒是蛮切合游戏主题

【人物角色】：拿锤子的男人，拿花伞的女人，武僧，幕府武士（我对日本文化不太了解只能直观描述）

【玩法】：分两个队伍-黑与白，黑队的黑色人物可以隐藏在黑色场景中（仅限站着不动时），但这白色场景中特别明显；白队的反之。
主要操作就是攻击和跳跃，攻击分为原地攻击和方向键+攻击，一般杀人都是方向键+攻击即冲刺斩。跳跃最多支持二段跳，一段跳跃后可接冲刺斩秀操作。再就是有一个道具键，可以使用捡到的道具（手里剑，铁蒺藜，烟雾弹）。还有一个可能用到的就是静步键，静步之后在相同颜色中行走不会被发现（跑不行），暗杀用（然而大部分时间都在冲刺斩，暗杀个毛）。
冲刺斩对冲刺斩会把两个人都弹开，有一种武侠小说里高手对招的快感
总之，有朋友一起玩的话还是挺推荐大家入，反正打折才7元。

★☆另外，欢迎各位小伙伴做客STEAM独立游戏吧，独立游戏爱好者聚集地~

review:
It's easy to pick up and for 1,99Euros a steal.

The 'blend-in' mechanic is one of the big selling points, even if that means you lose track of your own character sometimes.

For (up to 4 local players) multiplayer, there's "Deathmatch" and "Capture The Flag".

Both gamemodes are available for singleplayer too, with up to three AI players.
Here only "Capture The Flag" give some sort of challange if you got about 30mins playing experience.

There is the singleplayer only mode "Challange", where you have to achieve random goals. If you die the game stops.
Here lies the most challanging part for the singleplayer.

Verdict: I wouldn't buy it for singleplayer only. This is a great four player local couch game (even 3 vs 1 is possible). If you have friends and four controllers buy it (especially if it's on sale).

review:
The best 2d arena fighting game no one is playing. Reminds of Nidhogg without stepping on its toes, as its fighting style is brutal, enjoyable and completely different. Feels like playing an episode of Samurai Jack. This game will give you tense battles, hard fought victories and cheap sneak kills. Initially simple with its surface black and white capturing mechanic, it actually hides interesting quirks and deep technical mechanics, such as jump cancelling, animation buffering, double jump timings, and action priorities. 

Sorely needs online multiplayer to achieve its full potential, but from meeting the developers at EGX, know this is in their ambitions, even if perhaps its not in their immediate plans. Great game.

"Crouching Tiger, Hidden Bull Shit." [i]- me after losing a cap to a hidden friend[/i]

Think Samurai Gunn with a team-based light/shadow stealth element and capture the flag on top. Double jumping, wall jumping, aerial and rush attacks, slinking into the light or shadow, caltrops, shurikens, smoke bombs... tons of fun locally with four players (no online play)! The single-player challenge mode is great but the real meat is in multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007239254', 'num_games_owned': 4907, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1444076875}
review:
Black and White Bushido is a multiplayer arena fighting game that sees you fight in teams of black or white samurai in arenas where the background is either black or white. The general idea is when standing against your colour background you are invisible allowing for all sorts of sneaky stealth kills. Controlling your character feels fairly fluid and it won’t be long before you are bouncing around the level painting the fields red.

There are 4 different characters to choose from although I must admit they did not feel radically different from each other when being played. Scattered throughout the arena is also a number of power-ups ranging from throwing stars to bombs. While these are fun to use they are generally a single use item and I felt more could have been done with them.
The stealth mechanic works well especially with 4 players as it is impossible to keep track of where everyone is. The only real problem is that after dying and re-spawning it often took me a few moments to work out where the hell I was.

The main part of the game is deathmatch split into either straight deathmatch or capture the flag game types. With only 5 arenas to choose from you do pretty quickly yearn for some more selection. Equally the challenge mode which is the games only real single player element outside deathmatch with bots feature you completing a bunch of single player objectives without dying such as kill 3 people from behind or kill 3 people using wall jumps. While a nice little distraction this equally ends up as nothing more than a side mode due to the one hit kill and inability to continue.

I love the idea of the game and with 4 friends it’s an absolute blast. I first played the game at EGX2015 and came away thinking this was definitely a highlight of the day. But in reality without having 3 other people to play against it does not quite hold the same shine. So yes for an evening of multiplayer it’s great but it burns bright and fast and will grow old quickly.

Hopefully some more maps and modes down the line can help spice it up.

Please check out our video review below for gameplay footage.

http://www.thegametutor.co.uk/videos/game-tutor-grades/151006_game-tutor-grades-black-white-bushido

A review copy of the game was obtained from the developers free of charge. My thoughts and opinions are however totally my own.
